<div style="page-break-after: always;"></div>

## 1. Overview

This document defines the structure and related information of the Credential Definition used in OpenDID ZKP.

Credential Definition (CredDef) specifies how to issue a Credential according to a specific Credential Schema and its signing method.
The issuer must create a Credential Definition in order to issue Credentials.

The purpose of this document is to define the Credential Definition format.
The format is entirely defined using OSD (OpenDID Schema Definition Language).

### 1.1. Reference Documents

| Reference Name          | Document Title                           | Location |
| ------------------------ | ---------------------------------------- | -------- |
| [OSD]                    | OpenDID Schema Definition Language       |          |
| [ZKP-DATA-SPEC]          | (OpenDID) ZKP Data Specification         |          |
| [CREDENTIAL-FORMAT]      | (OpenDID) Credential Format               |          |

<div style="page-break-after: always;"></div>

## 2. Credential Definition Structure

For items not defined here, refer to `[ZKP-DATA-SPEC]`.

### 2.1. CredentialDefinition Object

Credential Definition (CredDef) specifies how to issue Credentials based on a specific Credential Schema and the signing method.

```c#
def object CredentialDefinition : "Credential Definition"
{
    + definition-identifier "id"          : "Credential Definition Identifier"
    + schema-identifier     "schemaId"    : "Credential Schema Identifier"
    + string                "ver"         : "Version"
    + CREDENTIAL_TYPE       "type"        : "Credential Signing Type"
    + object                "value"       : "value"
    {
        + object "primary" : "Primary Proof"
        {
            + string "n" :  "n"
            + string "z" :  "z"
            + string "s" :  "s"
            + object "r" :  "r", min_extend(2)
            {
                - string $attribute : "Attribute name, e.g., 'zkpsex' for gender"
                + string "masterSecret" : "Master Secret"
            }
            + string "rctxt" : "rctxt"
        }
    }
    + string "tag" : "Tag"
}
```

**Explanation:**
- `~/id`: Unique ID of the Credential Definition.
- `~/schemaId`: ID of the Credential Schema the Credential follows.
- `~/ver`: Version of the Credential Definition.
- `~/type`: Signing method used in the Credential. "CL" refers to Clairaut-Lippold signatures for ZKP-based Credentials.
- `~/value/primary`: Issuer’s signing keys and cryptographic parameters.
- `~/value/primary/n`, `z`, `s`: Components of the public key.
- `~/value/primary/r`: Cryptographic commitments for each attribute.
- `~/value/primary/r/masterSecret`: Commitment for the holder’s Master Secret.
- `~/value/primary/rctxt`: Blinding factor used during issuance.
- `~/tag`: Tag used to distinguish between multiple Credential Definitions under the same Schema.

<div style="page-break-after: always;"></div>

## 3. Example

This chapter provides a concrete example to aid understanding of the Credential Definition.

### 3.2. Driver’s License Credential Definition

```json
{
    "id": "did:omn:NcYxiDXkpYi6ov5FcYDi1e:3:CL:did:omn:NcYxiDXkpYi6ov5FcYDi1e:2:mdl:1.0:Tag1",
    "schemaId": "did:omn:NcYxiDXkpYi6ov5FcYDi1e:2:mdl:1.0",
    "ver": "1.0",
    "type": "CL",
    "value": {
      "primary": {
        "n": "",
        "z": "",
        "s": "",
        "r": {
          "zkpsex": "",
          "zkpasort": "",
          "zkpaddr": "",
          "zkpbirth": "",
          "masterSecret": ""
        },
        "rctxt": ""
      }
    },
    "tag": "Tag1"
  }
}
```
